result.execSummary:
The defendant Renildo Jesus Puentes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample. Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges. Court further ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Dept. of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes:
- No use or possession of prescription medication without a valid prescription.
- No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause.
- NO CONTACT with any Best But store in Milwaukee, any Meijer store in Milwaukee, any Walgreen's in Milwaukee, any Wisconsin Vision in Milwaukee, and any At Home store in Milwaukee.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety. 
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Renildo Jesus Puentes

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Renildo Jesus Puentes in court, in custody.  Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court for Renildo Jesus Puentes.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for sentencing.  Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS with 0 days credit, CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and IS ELIGIBLE for the WI Substance Abuse program.


CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety. 
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers.
- Provide DNA sample.
- No use or possession of prescription medication WITHOUT a valid prescription.
- No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause. 
- Maintain employment. 
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department. 
- NO CONTACT with any Best Buy store in Milwaukee, any Meijer store in Milwaukee, any Walgreen's in Milwaukee, any Wisconsin Vision in Milwaukee, and any At Home store in Milwaukee.


Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.

Court further ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

20 day appeal rights given.  Firearms and voting rights given.

Defendant Renildo Jesus Puentes in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Defendant Renildo Jesus Puentes in custody.  Amanda Kirklewski for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Renildo Jesus Puentes in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defendant is advised is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  
Defendant is advised unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  

Defendant REMANDED pending sentencing. 

Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 02.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court, defendant Renildo Jesus Puentes not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 room G55 CJF.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Renildo Jesus Puentes in court with Attorney Eugene E. Detert; both appear by video.  Defendant Renildo Jesus Puentes in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Status conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Renildo Jesus Puentes not in court, defendant in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Wisconsin Vision, 5530 N. Port Washington Rd., Glendale, WI
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Renildo Jesus Puentes in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Renildo Jesus Puentes in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Renildo Jesus Puentes appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Renildo Jesus Puentes
Current: 10420 W Upham Ave, Hales Corners, WI 53130   (Effective: 03-18-2022)
Prior: 10420 W Upham Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53130
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
